definition: foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks

sentences.english: The images of women barefoot on the street, handcuffed and tied to a rope, enraged internet users.
sentences.chinese: 被繩子綁住的婦女赤腳走在街上的畫面激怒了網民。

sentences.english: Adema is wearing shorts and a T-shirt, but has no shoes on.
sentences.chinese: 阿迪馬穿着短褲和T恤，但卻打着赤腳。

sentences.english: But podiatrists urge caution before running without shoes.
sentences.chinese: 但是足病診療師勸說在赤腳跑步之前一定要小心。

sentences.english: We climbed out of the rubble barefooted.
"Daisen barefoot, " was born in the telecommunications institute in this regard.
sentences.chinese: “赤腳大仙”就此誕生在電信學院。

sentences.english: It is called Barefoot College, and so far it has trained thousands.
sentences.chinese: 這被稱爲“赤腳大學”，目前已經培訓了數千人。

sentences.english: He dashed into my room, hatless, barefooted and out of breath.
sentences.chinese: 他光頭赤腳，氣喘噓噓地衝進我的房間來。

sentences.english: The children go barefoot in summer.
He put a soft carpet under your car-seat , since you like bare feet.
sentences.chinese: 你喜歡赤腳，他在副駕駛的位置腳下鋪一小塊羊絨毯。

sentences.english: When I was walking barefoot, he would stop and kiss the soles of my feet.
sentences.chinese: 當我赤腳走路的時候，他會停下來親吻我的足底。

sentences.english: One group had always run shoeless.
sentences.chinese: 一組是經常赤腳跑步的。

sentences.english: Most people didn t wear shoes.
sentences.chinese: 人們幾乎不穿鞋，赤腳行走。

sentences.english: He, too, leaned back, wiggling his unshod toes before the coals.
sentences.chinese: 他也向後倚了過去，在火堆前晃晃赤腳的腳趾。

sentences.english: Some children in poor countries go about barefooted .
sentences.chinese: 在貧窮國家的一些孩子們仍然打着赤腳。

definition: foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
messy hair and dirty face/bad appearance

(martial arts) wind-and-fire wheel, weapon used in hand-to-hand fighting/(Daoism) a magical pair of wheels on which one can stand to ride at great speed, used by Nezha 哪吒[Ne2 zha5]/(fig.) never-ending treadmill
